tn.text: "place where you were slaves"

tn.ref: You must have no other gods before me
tn.text: "You must not worship any other gods but me"
"and you must not make the likeness"

tn.ref: You must not bow down to them or worship them
tn.text: The word "them" refers to carved figures or idols.
God wants his people to worship only him.

tn.ref: punish the ancestors' wickedness by bringing punishment on the descendants
tn.text: God will punish people for the sin of their parents.

tn.ref: the third and the fourth generation
tn.text: "the 3rd and the 4th generation." Here "third" and "fourth" are ordinal numbers for "3" and "4." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: I show covenant faithfulness to thousands
tn.text: "because of my covenant, I am faithful to thousands" or "I faithfully love thousands"
"many generations of those"
"use my name"
"carelessly" or "without proper respect"
"I will certainly consider guilty" or "I will certainly punish" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
"do all your usual duties"
Cities often had walls around them to keep out enemies, and gates for people to go in and out. AT: "within your community" or "inside your city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"on day seven." Here "seventh" is the ordinal number for "7." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
Possible meanings are that 1) God caused the Sabbath day to produce good results, or 2) God said that the Sabbath day was good.
"set it apart for a special purpose"
"You must not have sex with anyone other than your spouse"
"must not speak a false report" or "must not tell lies about someone"
"must not strongly want to have" or "must not want to take"
"sound"
"smoke coming from the mountain"
"they shook with fear"
"stood far away" or "stood at a distance" (UDB)

tn.ref: so that the honor of him may be in you, and so that you do not sin
tn.text: "so that you will honor him and not sin"
"went closer to"

tn.ref: This is what you must tell the Israelites
tn.text: "Tell the Israelites this"

tn.ref: You yourselves have seen that I have talked with you from heaven
tn.text: "You have heard me speak to you from heaven"

tn.ref: You will not make for yourselves other gods alongside me
tn.text: "You must not make idols as other gods instead of me"

tn.ref: gods of silver or gods of gold
tn.text: "gods made out of silver or gold" or "idols made out of silver or gold"
an altar made of materials from the ground, such as stone, soil, or clay

tn.ref: cause my name to be honored
tn.text: Here "name" is a metonym for God's being. This can be stated in active form. AT: "choose for you to honor me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You must not go up by steps to my altar
tn.text: "Do not make an altar that has steps"
"showing your naked body"
